medical_history.chief_complaint: Bilateral carotid body tumors (CBTs), noted as a mass on the right side of the neck.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient noticed the mass approximately 6 months before seeking medical attention, remaining asymptomatic during this period until post-embolization complications occurred, including mild hemodynamic instability (bradycardia and hypotension) following the second embolization.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 5-year history of hypertension that had been relatively resistant to medical management.
medical_history.family_history: Significant for hypertension; paternal grandmother, 2 paternal cousins, and sister had CBTs.
